column5: At the end of August I went Northern Pike fishing with my brother-in-law.  Now, my brother-in-law only ever fishes for pike and smallmouth bass. That is because he only ever fishes with one lure - a #3 Mepps spinner - which means he is pretty much limited to fishing in shallow water. So, if the smallies are deep - then we are pike fishing!  We caught lots of small pike - quite a bit smaller than what had previously been the average size in the area. We also caught a few good ones and my brother-in-law caught his biggest pike to date - his personal best. It was really too big for his equipment as you will see in the video but we did manage to net it. Very nice pike! I find it hilarious that he only uses one lure - but I'm glad it's not just a pickerel rig like my friend, heh.  I never catch anything on my Mepps #3..
Did ya notice the old school back wind Dara? NO DRAG.  Thats an old rod aswell. My pop was going to throw one of them away,til I snatched it from the trash.

Yeah, it is hilarious alright. I think he used the reel for catching tiny trout in the Yukon and it probably has 6 lb test on it. The rod he is using was an old one that I got when an elderly relative died. I gave it to him because it was still better than his own light action rod!
Imagine what would happen if he went with a Mepps #5  Great video....thanks for taking the time to put it together and share it
Y'know if I was forced to use just one lure, a #3 Mepps wouldn't be a bad choice.  Cool song, your bro in law seems like a pretty interesting dude.
That is true. The #3 Mepps catches walleye too when shallow against the shore.... where he fishes. If you could only have one lure it is not a bad choice
I don't know about Dara, but I sure did!
